curam.util.client.domain.marshal
Interface DomainMarshal

All Superinterfaces:
DomainPlugIn, PlugIn
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractDomainMarshal, SimpleXPathADCMarshal, SimpleXPathMarshal
public interface DomainMarshal
extends DomainPlugIn

A domain marshal takes form data submitted by a user and converts it into a format that can be used to set a property of a BOPI. It also resolves paths to values embedded in single values of more complex domains. For most domains, this is a trivial task: a value in the form data is simply passed straight through to the BOPI and vice versa. However, for some domains--addresses are a common example--the form data is submitted in several pieces that must be reassembled and converted into the correct format. Likewise, when displaying an address, the individual address parts must be parsed from the address data.

Like other domain plug-ins, the expectation is that this interface will be implemented in a manner that is thread-safe and stateless. For this reason, there is no guarantee that any data stored in fields of an instance of an implementation class will be available across calls to the methods on the interface, so the mechanism provided to prepare data for path resolution should be the only mechanism relied upon.

Constant Field Values
Method Detail

preResolve

java.lang.Object preResolve(java.lang.String data)
                            throws MarshalException
Initializes a value for before paths are resolved. For complex domains, the "get" methods may be called several times, so it could be inefficient if they had to parse the data every time they had to resolve a value embedded in it. This method allows the marshal to perform this kind of preparatory processing once and to create an object that will be more suitable for use by the "get" methods. Any object can be returned, or the value string itself can be returned. The object will be passed to one of the "get" methods each time a path is resolved.

Parameters:
data - The string value to be prepared. This is the value that has been formatted by the converter.
Returns:
The object that will be passed to a "get" method when paths are resolved.
Throws:
MarshalException - If there is an error preparing the data.

assemble

java.lang.String assemble(java.util.Map<Path,FormItem> data)
                          throws MarshalException
Assembles a set of FormItem objects, each identified by the extended portion of a path to a value embedded in a single property value. The form items provide the value and label information. The paths and form items are provided in a map keyed by path. A marshal may validate the individual values being assembled; if an error is detected, an exception may be thrown. Exceptions may be chained together in the usual manner to report more than one problem. The infrastructure guarantees that the map will never be empty or null.

Parameters:
data - The map associating paths with form items.
Returns:
The assembled value that will be parsed and validated by the domain converter.
Throws:
MarshalException - If errors occur when assembling the data.

get

java.lang.String get(java.lang.Object data,
                     Path path)
                     throws MarshalException
Resolves a path to a value embedded in a value of a complex type of domain. It is not always necessary to provide a complex implementation of this method, as the renderer may perform this work internally. A renderer may perform the parsing or may use an XSLT stylesheet or other means. The data to be used to resolve the path is the object returned from the DomainMarshal.preResolve(String) method.

Parameters:
data - The data to used when resolving the path.
path - The path to be resolved. The root of the path is the data itself; it does not include the path steps that select the server interface property.
Returns:
The string representation of the value that was resolved.
Throws:
MarshalException - If the path cannot be resolved.

getRaw

java.lang.Object getRaw(java.lang.Object data,
                        Path path)
                        throws MarshalException
Resolves a path to a value embedded in a value of a complex type of domain. The raw, unformatted, value of the data is returned. It is not always necessary to provide a complex implementation of this method, as the renderer may perform this work internally. A renderer may perform the parsing or may use an XSLT stylesheet or other means. The data to be used to resolve the path is the object returned from the DomainMarshal.preResolve(String) method.

Parameters:
data - The data to used when resolving the path.
path - The path to be resolved. The root of the path is the data itself; it does not include the path steps that select the server interface property.
Returns:
The raw Object representation of the value that was resolved.
Throws:
MarshalException - If the path cannot be resolved.

getList

java.util.List<java.lang.String> getList(java.lang.Object data,
                                         Path path)
                                         throws MarshalException
Resolves a path to a list of values embedded in a value of a complex type of domain. It is not always necessary to provide a complex implementation of this method, as the renderer may perform this work internally. A renderer may perform the parsing or may use an XSLT stylesheet or other means. The data to be used to resolve the path is the object returned from the DomainMarshal.preResolve(String) method.

Parameters:
data - The data to used when resolving the path.
path - The path to be resolved. The root of the path is the data itself; it does not include the path steps that select the server interface property.
Returns:
A list of the formatted values embedded in the complex object specified by the path.
Throws:
MarshalException - If the path cannot be resolved.

                                            throws MarshalException

It is not always necessary to provide a complex implementation of this method, as the renderer may perform this work internally. A renderer may perform the parsing or may use an XSLT stylesheet or other means. The data to be used to resolve the path is the object returned from the DomainMarshal.preResolve(String) method.

Parameters:

path - The path to be resolved. The root of the path is the data itself; it does not include the path steps that select the server interface property.
Returns:
A list of the unformatted values embedded in the complex object specified by the path.
Throws:
MarshalException - If the path cannot be resolved.

count

int count(java.lang.Object data,
          Path path)
          throws MarshalException

Gets the count of the values embedded in the complex object identified by the path. This may be more efficient than getting a list of values and then getting the size of the list if the list would not otherwise be used. The count will always be the same as the size of the list retrieved for the same path. Generally, where the DomainMarshal.getList(Object, Path) method would throw an exception, this method will also throw an exception, for example, if the path does not resolve to a list.

When iterating over the elements in a list, do not use this method in the loop condition to control the number of iterations, as it may be very inefficient to call it repeatedly. Instead, get the list of values and get the size from the list using java.util.List.size() or use the list iterator.

Parameters:
data - The data to used when resolving the path.
path - The path to be resolved.
Returns:
The number of values identified by the path.
Throws:
MarshalException - If the count cannot be calculated.
